abstract: Fox proved dominant in the ratings on Monday with the combination of “House” and “24,” leading both the 8 and 9 p.m. time slots with 15.6 million and 12.1 million viewers, respectively, according to Nielsen’s estimates.
snippet: Fox proved dominant in the ratings on Monday with the combination of “House” and “24,” leading both the 8 and 9 p.m. time slots with 15.6 million and 12.1 million viewers, respectively, according to Nielsen’s estimates.
lead_paragraph: Fox proved dominant in the ratings on Monday with the combination of “House” and “24,” leading both the 8 and 9 p.m. time slots with 15.6 million and 12.1 million viewers, respectively, according to Nielsen’s estimates.
